Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water to show it growing well.
The student can draw a plant that is not getting enough water to show it wilting or not growing well.
The student can include a sun in the drawing to represent the importance of light for plant growth.
The student can show differences in plant color or size to indicate the presence or absence of water.
The student can observe and use patterns, such as leaves looking healthy in the well-watered plant versus looking dry in the non-watered plant.
